member.name: T:Postgrest.Attributes.ColumnAttribute
member.summary: Used to map a C# property to a Postgrest Column.

member.name: P:Postgrest.Attributes.ColumnAttribute.ColumnName
member.summary: The name in postgres of this column.

member.name: P:Postgrest.Attributes.ColumnAttribute.NullValueHandling
member.summary: Specifies what should be serialized in the event this column's value is NULL

member.name: P:Postgrest.Attributes.ColumnAttribute.IgnoreOnInsert
member.summary: If the performed query is an Insert or Upsert, should this value be ignored?

member.name: P:Postgrest.Attributes.ColumnAttribute.IgnoreOnUpdate
member.summary: If the performed query is an Update, should this value be ignored?

member.name: T:Postgrest.Attributes.PrimaryKeyAttribute
member.summary: Used to map a C# property to a Postgrest PrimaryKey.

member.name: P:Postgrest.Attributes.PrimaryKeyAttribute.ShouldInsert
member.summary: Would be set to false in the event that the database handles the generation of this property.

member.name: T:Postgrest.Attributes.ReferenceAttribute
member.summary:
Used to specify that a foreign key relationship exists in PostgreSQL
See: https://postgrest.org/en/stable/api.html#resource-embedding

member.name: T:Postgrest.Attributes.ReferenceAttribute.JoinType
member.summary: Specifies the Join type on this reference. PostgREST only allows for a LEFT join and an INNER join.

member.name: F:Postgrest.Attributes.ReferenceAttribute.JoinType.Inner
member.summary: INNER JOIN: returns rows when there is a match on both the source and the referenced tables.

member.name: F:Postgrest.Attributes.ReferenceAttribute.JoinType.Left
member.summary: LEFT JOIN: returns all rows from the source table, even if there are no matches in the referenced table

member.name: P:Postgrest.Attributes.ReferenceAttribute.Model
member.summary: Type of the model referenced

member.name: P:Postgrest.Attributes.ReferenceAttribute.PropertyName
member.summary: Associated property name

member.name: P:Postgrest.Attributes.ReferenceAttribute.TableName
member.summary: Table name of model

member.name: P:Postgrest.Attributes.ReferenceAttribute.Columns
member.summary: Columns that exist on the model we will select from.

member.name: P:Postgrest.Attributes.ReferenceAttribute.IgnoreOnInsert
member.summary: If the performed query is an Insert or Upsert, should this value be ignored? (DEFAULT TRUE)

member.name: P:Postgrest.Attributes.ReferenceAttribute.IgnoreOnUpdate
member.summary: If the performed query is an Update, should this value be ignored? (DEFAULT TRUE)

member.name: P:Postgrest.Attributes.ReferenceAttribute.IncludeInQuery
member.summary: If Reference should automatically be included in queries on this reference. (DEFAULT TRUE)

member.name: P:Postgrest.Attributes.ReferenceAttribute.UseInnerJoin
member.summary:
As to whether the query will filter top-level rows.
See: https://postgrest.org/en/stable/api.html#resource-embedding

member.name: M:Postgrest.Attributes.ReferenceAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,Postgrest.Attributes.ReferenceAttribute.JoinType,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Establishes a reference between two tables
member.param: Model referenced
Should referenced be included in queries?
Should reference data be excluded from inserts/upserts?
Should reference data be excluded from updates?
Specifies the join type for this relationship

member.name: M:Postgrest.Attributes.ReferenceAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Establishes a reference between two tables
member.param: Model referenced
Should referenced be included in queries?
Should reference data be excluded from inserts/upserts?
Should reference data be excluded from updates?
As to whether the query will filter top-level rows.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Client.SerializerSettings(Postgrest.ClientOptions)
member.summary:
Custom Serializer resolvers and converters that will be used for encoding and decoding Postgrest JSON responses.
By default, Postgrest seems to use a date format that C# and Newtonsoft do not like, so this initial configuration handles that.

member.name: P:Postgrest.Client.GetHeaders
member.summary:
Function that can be set to return dynamic headers.
Headers specified in the constructor options will ALWAYS take precedence over headers returned by this function.

member.summary: Should be the first call to this class to initialize a connection with a Postgrest API Server
member.param: Api Endpoint (ex: "http://localhost:8000"), no trailing slash required.

member.summary: Name of the Table parsed by the Model.

member.summary: Adds an AND Filter to the current query args.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Interfaces.IPostgrestTable`1.Clear
member.summary: Clears currently defined query values.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Interfaces.IPostgrestTable`1.Columns(System.String[])
member.summary:
By using the columns query parameter it’s possible to specify the payload keys that will be inserted and ignore the rest of the payload.
The rest of the JSON keys will be ignored. Using this also has the side-effect of being more efficient for Bulk Insert since PostgREST will not process the JSON and it’ll send it directly to PostgreSQL.
See: https://postgrest.org/en/stable/api.html#specifying-columns

member.name: M:Postgrest.Interfaces.IPostgrestTable`1.Columns(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Object[]}})
member.summary:
By using the columns query parameter it’s possible to specify the payload keys that will be inserted and ignore the rest of the payload.
The rest of the JSON keys will be ignored. Using this also has the side-effect of being more efficient for Bulk Insert since PostgREST will not process the JSON and it’ll send it directly to PostgreSQL.
See: https://postgrest.org/en/stable/api.html#specifying-columns

.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Interfaces.IPostgrestTable`1.Range(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets a FROM range, similar to a `StartAt` query.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Interfaces.IPostgrestTable`1.Range(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets a bounded range to the current query.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Interfaces.IPostgrestTable`1.Select(System.String)
member.summary: Select columns for query.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Interfaces.IPostgrestTable`1.Select(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Object[]}})
member.summary:
Select columns using a predicate function.
For example: `Table<Movie>().Select(x => new[] { x.Id, x.Name, x.CreatedAt }).Get();`
member.param: Expects an array of columns from the Model to be returned.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Interfaces.IPostgrestTable`1.Where(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Boolean}})
member.summary:
Filter a query based on a predicate function.
Note: Chaining multiple calls will be parsed as an "AND" query.
Examples: `Table<Movie>().Where(x => x.Name == "Top Gun").Get();` `Table<Movie>().Where(x => x.Name == "Top Gun" || x.Name == "Mad Max").Get();` `Table<Movie>().Where(x => x.Name.Contains("Gun")).Get();` `Table<Movie>().Where(x => x.CreatedAt <= new DateTime(2022, 08, 21)).Get();` `Table<Movie>().Where(x => x.Id > 5 && x.Name.Contains("Max")).Get();`

member.name: M:Postgrest.Interfaces.IPostgrestTable`1.Single(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Executes a query that expects to have a single object returned, rather than returning list of models it will return a single model.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Interfaces.IPostgrestTable`1.Set(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Object}},System.Object)
member.summary:
Specifies a key and value to be updated. Should be combined with filters/where clauses.
Can be called multiple times to set multiple values.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Interfaces.IPostgrestTable`1.Set(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{System.Object,System.Object}}})
member.summary:
Specifies a KeyValuePair to be updated. Should be combined with filters/where clauses.
Can be called multiple times to set multiple values.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Interfaces.IPostgrestTable`1.Update(Postgrest.QueryOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Calls an Update function after `Set` has been called.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Interfaces.IPostgrestTable`1.Update(`0,Postgrest.QueryOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Executes an UPDATE query using the defined query params on the current instance.
member.returns: A typed response from the database.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Interfaces.IPostgrestTable`1.Upsert(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{`0},Postgrest.QueryOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Executes an UPSERT query using the defined query params on the current instance.
By default the new record is returned. Set QueryOptions.ReturnType to Minimal if you don't need this value. By specifying the QueryOptions.OnConflict parameter, you can make UPSERT work on a column(s) that has a UNIQUE constraint. QueryOptions.DuplicateResolution.IgnoreDuplicates Specifies if duplicate rows should be ignored and not inserted.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Interfaces.IPostgrestTable`1.Upsert(`0,Postgrest.QueryOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Executes an UPSERT query using the defined query params on the current instance.
By default the new record is returned. Set QueryOptions.ReturnType to Minimal if you don't need this value. By specifying the QueryOptions.OnConflict parameter, you can make UPSERT work on a column(s) that has a UNIQUE constraint. QueryOptions.DuplicateResolution.IgnoreDuplicates Specifies if duplicate rows should be ignored and not inserted.

member.name: T:Postgrest.Index
member.summary: Represent a type can be used to index a collection either from the start or the end.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Index.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct an Index using a value and indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.param: The index value. it has to be zero or positive number.
Indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.remarks: If the Index constructed from the end, index value 1 means pointing at the last element and index value 0 means pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: P:Postgrest.Index.Start
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at first element.

member.name: P:Postgrest.Index.End
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Index.FromStart(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the start at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the start.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Index.FromEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the end at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the end.

member.name: P:Postgrest.Index.Value
member.summary: Returns the index value.

member.name: P:Postgrest.Index.IsFromEnd
member.summary: Indicates whether the index is from the start or the end.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Index.GetOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the offset from the start using the giving collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the Index will be used with. length has to be a positive value
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter and the returned offset value against negative values. we don't validate either the returned offset is greater than the input length. It is expected Index will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. If the returned offset is negative and then used to index a collection will get out of range exception which will be same affect as the validation.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Index.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:Postgrest.Index.Equals(Postgrest.Index)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another Index object.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:Postgrest.Index.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Index.op_Implicit(System.Int32)~Postgrest.Index
member.summary: Converts integer number to an Index.

member.name: M:Postgrest.Index.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of the current Index object to its equivalent string representation.

member.name: T:Postgrest.IntRange
member.summary: Represent a range has start and end indexes.

member.name: P:Postgrest.IntRange.Start
member.summary: Represent the inclusive start index of the Range.

member.name: P:Postgrest.IntRange.End
member.summary: Represent the exclusive end index of the Range.

member.name: M:Postgrest.IntRange.#ctor(Postgrest.Index,Postgrest.Index)
member.summary: Construct a Range object using the start and end indexes.
member.param: Represent the inclusive start index of the range.
Represent the exclusive end index of the range.

member.name: M:Postgrest.IntRange.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Range object is equal to another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:Postgrest.IntRange.Equals(Postgrest.IntRange)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Range object is equal to another Range object.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:Postgrest.IntRange.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:Postgrest.IntRange.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of the current Range object to its equivalent string representation.

member.name: M:Postgrest.IntRange.StartAt(Postgrest.Index)
member.summary: Create a Range object starting from start index to the end of the collection.

member.name: M:Postgrest.IntRange.EndAt(Postgrest.Index)
member.summary: Create a Range object starting from first element in the collection to the end Index.

member.name: P:Postgrest.IntRange.All
member.summary: Create a Range object starting from first element to the end.

member.name: M:Postgrest.IntRange.GetOffsetAndLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the start offset and length of range object using a collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the range will be used with. length has to be a positive value.
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter against negative values. It is expected Range will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. We validate the range is inside the length scope though.

member.name: T:Postgrest.Linq.SelectExpressionVisitor

Called like: `Table<Movies>().Select(x => new[] { x.Id, x.Name, x.CreatedAt }).Get()`

member.summary: Value to be updated.

member.summary: A Unary Node, delved into to represent a property on a BaseModel.

member.summary: A Member Node, representing a property on a BaseModel.

member.summary: Helper class for parsing Where linq queries.

member.summary: The filter resulting from this Visitor, capable of producing nested filters.

member.summary:
An entry point that will be used to populate .
Invoked like: `Table<Movies>().Where(x => x.Name == "Top Gun").Get();`

member.summary: Called when evaluating a method

member.summary: A constant expression parser (i.e. x => x.Id == 5 <- where '5' is the constant)

member.name: M:Postgrest.Linq.WhereExpressionVisitor.HandleMemberExpression(System.String,Postgrest.Constants.Operator,System.Linq.Expressions.MemberExpression)
member.summary: A member expression parser (i.e. => x.Id == Example.Id <- where both `x.Id` and `Example.Id` are parsed as 'members')

member.summary: A unary expression parser (i.e. => x.Id == 1 <- where both `1` is considered unary)

member.summary: An instantiated class parser (i.e. x => x.CreatedAt <= new DateTime(2022, 08, 20) <- where `new DateTime(...)` is an instantiated expression.

member.summary: Get the value from a MemberExpression, which includes both fields and properties.

member.summary: Creates map between linq and

member.summary: Gets arguments from a method call expression, (i.e. x => x.Name.Contains("Top")) <- where `Top` is the argument on the called method `Contains`

member.summary: Abstract class that must be implemented by C# Postgrest Models.

member.name: P:Postgrest.Models.BaseModel.PrimaryKey
member.summary: Gets the values of the PrimaryKey columns (there can be multiple) on a model's instance as defined by the [PrimaryKey] attributes on a property on the model.

member.name: T:Postgrest.Table`1
member.summary:
Class created from a model derived from `BaseModel` that can generate query requests to a Postgrest Endpoint.
Representative of a `USE $TABLE` command.

member.summary: Typically called from the Client `new Client.Table<ModelType>`

Optional client configuration.

member.summary: Generates the encoded URL with defined query parameters that will be sent to the Postgrest API.

member.summary: Transforms an object into a string mapped list/dictionary using `JsonSerializerSettings`.

Transforms the defined filters into the expected Postgrest format.
